files./etc/keyd/default.conf:
[ids]
*

[main]
# Map physical Left Command (Meta) to our custom 'meta_mac' layer.
leftmeta = layer(meta_mac)

# Map physical Left Alt (Option) to Meta (Super/Windows key).
# This gives you a dedicated key for GNOME Overview/Snapping (Super+Arrows).
leftalt = layer(meta)

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# THE ALT-BASE LAYER ([meta_mac:A])
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Critical Logic: This layer inherits from ':A' (Alt).
# 1. Holding physical Command is seen by the OS as holding Alt.
# 2. This ensures Cmd+Tab behaves exactly like Alt+Tab (Switch Application),
#    keeping the switcher UI open as long as the key is held.
# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

[meta_mac:A]

# --- WINDOW SWITCHING (Native Behavior) ---
# We do NOT remap Tab. Because we inherit :A, pressing Tab sends Alt+Tab.
# We do NOT remap Grave (`). Pressing it sends Alt+` (GNOME Switch Group).


# --- TERMINAL & CLIPBOARD COMPATIBILITY (IBM CUA) ---
# Problem: Cmd+C usually sends Ctrl+C (Interrupt).
# Solution: Map Cmd+C/V/X to the "Insert" variants.
# This works in Terminals (Copy/Paste) AND GUI Apps (Copy/Paste) identically.
c = C-insert
v = S-insert
x = S-delete


# --- THE INVERSION FIX (Map Alt back to Control) ---
# Since this layer defaults to Alt, pressing 'T' would send 'Alt+T'.
# We must explicitly force every shortcut key to send 'Control+Key' instead.

a = C-a
b = C-b
d = C-d
e = C-e
f = C-f
g = C-g
h = C-h
i = C-i
j = C-j
k = C-k
l = C-l
m = C-m
n = C-n
o = C-o
p = C-p
q = C-q
r = C-r
s = C-s
t = C-t
u = C-u
w = C-w
y = C-y
z = C-z


# --- SYMBOLS & NAVIGATION (Mac Style) ---

# Text Navigation
# Cmd+Left/Right -> Home/End (Start/End of line)
left = home
right = end
# Cmd+Up/Down -> Start/End of document
up = C-home
down = C-end

# Common IDE/Browser Shortcuts
# Cmd+/ (Comment/Help) -> Ctrl+/
/ = C-/
# Cmd+[ / Cmd+] (Indent/Dedent) -> Ctrl+[ / Ctrl+]
[ = C-[
…<truncated>…
